input:
Sophia is a biologist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 13), my wife (birthday on September 19), my child_1 (birthday on September 06), my father (birthday on July 27), my mother (birthday on June 05), 
2) Attending a fashion week in Paris in week 24-25.

3) Attend a parenting workshop every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Sophia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_range.24: Attending a fashion week in Paris

Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

 Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
The second week of the year was filled with a flurry of activity, both at home and at work. At the lab, we were deep into the planning stages of our new projects, with brainstorming sessions and design meetings taking place daily. I was particularly excited about a new collaboration with a local architectural firm, which could lead to some groundbreaking advancements in sustainable urban design. Meanwhile, at home, my wife and I were busy organizing the kids' schedules for the upcoming school year. We signed them up for various extracurricular activities, including soccer, art classes, and music lessons. The evenings were spent helping them with their homework and preparing healthy meals. The week ended on a high note with a family dinner, where we shared stories of our week and looked forward to the adventures that the new year would bring.

 Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
The third week of the year was marked by a sudden change in the weather. The temperatures rose dramatically, melting the snow and ice that had blanketed our neighborhood just a few days prior. The sudden thaw brought a sense of renewal, as the world around us came back to life. At work, we were making good progress on our projects, with several key milestones reached. I spent the week working on the final designs for the energy-efficient building project, collaborating closely with the architects and engineers to ensure a seamless integration of technology and aesthetics. At home, the kids were enjoying the warmer weather, playing outside and exploring the neighborhood. We took advantage of the mild temperatures to plan a family outing to the botanical gardens, where we spent the day marveling at the vibrant colors and fragrances of the flowers.

At home, the kids were keeping us on our toes with their endless energy and curiosity. We spent the evenings playing games, reading stories, and helping them with their homework. The week ended on a positive note, with a successful presentation of our project proposals to the company's executive board.

Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

I was particularly excited about a new collaboration with a local architectural firm, which could lead to some groundbreaking innovations in sustainable urban design. The week flew by in a whirlwind of productivity and anticipation, leaving us all eager for the weekend celebrations.

Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. input:
Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 9 for tailor and custom dressmaking use.
  - Designate Floor 13 for martial arts dojo use.
  - Designate Floor 12 for boutique use.
  - Designate Floor 48 for baking and culinary school use.
  - Designate Floor 23 for art gallery use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 79 to 83 for a corporate headquarters for a major company.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a restaurant every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

Floor 1:
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.
 Floor 2:
This floor is dedicated to a state-of-the-art fitness center, equipped with the latest cardio and strength training machines. The floor also includes a yoga and Pilates studio, sauna, and steam room, providing a comprehensive wellness experience for residents and employees.
 Floor 3:
This floor houses a daycare center, designed to cater to the needs of working parents. The center includes a spacious play area, quiet rooms for napping, and a kitchen area for preparing meals. The staff are trained professionals, ensuring the safety and well-being of the children.
 Floor 4:

 Floor 5:
This floor is designated for a conference center, featuring multiple meeting rooms of various sizes, equipped with the latest audiovisual technology. The center also includes a large banquet hall, perfect for hosting corporate events, seminars, and weddings.
 Floor 6:
This floor is dedicated to a rooftop garden, offering breathtaking views of the city skyline. The garden includes a variety of plants, trees, and flowers, creating a serene and tranquil environment. The space also includes seating areas, perfect for relaxation and meditation.
 Floor 7:
This floor is dedicated to a library, offering a quiet and peaceful environment for reading and research. The library includes a vast collection of books, periodicals, and research materials, as well as comfortable seating areas and study rooms.

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 32 for real estate agency use.
  - Designate Floor 77 for photography studio use.
  - Designate Floor 71 for language school use.
  - Designate Floor 18 for veterinary clinic use.
  - Designate Floor 49 for retail store use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 3 to 9 for a advanced technology and research institute.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a observatory every 30 floors, starting from Floor 50
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

input:
Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 75 for conference room use.
  - Designate Floor 12 for office use.
  - Designate Floor 64 for legal services use.
  - Designate Floor 99 for boutique use.
  - Designate Floor 35 for veterinary clinic use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 49 to 54 for a extensive fitness and recreational gym.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a observatory every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

Floor 1:
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 43 for retail store use.
  - Designate Floor 21 for small cinema use.
  - Designate Floor 52 for architecture firm use.
  - Designate Floor 85 for pharmacy use.
  - Designate Floor 8 for medical office use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 9 to 15 for a comprehensive library with study areas and archives.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a outdoor terrace every 20 floors, starting from Floor 40
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***

An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. 1) Specific floors requirements:

4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.

This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 01-21 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 05-13 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
1.4 Celebrate 'April Fool's Surprise Menu' on 04-01 with a special dish: Mystery Dish.
1.5 Celebrate 'Restaurant's 10th Anniversary' on 09-19 with a special dish: Champagne and Caviar.
2) Feature 'Game Meat Fortnight' from Week 26 to Week 28 with dishes like: Venison Steaks.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 12, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. The shrimp are succulent and sweet, while the cocktail sauce adds a tangy, spicy kick.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. The earthy flavor of the mushrooms is beautifully complemented by the savory, aromatic cheese filling.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. The rich, velvety sauce clings to the tender lobster meat, creating a luxurious and indulgent dish.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. The crispy skin gives way to juicy, flavorful meat, while the sweet orange glaze adds a delightful contrast.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. The subtle garlic flavor adds depth and complexity to the classic dish, making it a perfect accompaniment to the rich main courses.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. The glaze adds a touch of sweetness and a beautiful sheen to the carrots, making them a delightful and colorful addition to the meal.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. The velvety texture and intense chocolate flavor make this a decadent and indulgent dessert that is sure to satisfy any sweet tooth.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. The coffee-infused ladyfingers are soft and spongey, while the creamy mascarpone cheese adds a rich, velvety texture.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. The sommelier will be happy to help you choose the perfect pairing for your meal.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week's menu features a selection of dishes that are both comforting and nourishing, perfect for the cold winter weather.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Tomato Soup: A classic, hearty tomato soup served with a grilled cheese sandwich. The soup is rich and flavorful, while the grilled cheese adds a perfect balance of savory, melted cheese and toasty bread.
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy, savory dip made with spinach, artichokes, and a blend of cheeses. Served with warm pita bread, it's a delicious and satisfying appetizer.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Stroganoff: Tender strips of beef cooked in a rich, savory sauce with mushrooms, onions, and sour cream. Served over egg noodles, it's a hearty and comforting dish that is sure to warm you up.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A classic comfort food dish featuring tender chicken, vegetables, and a flaky, buttery crust. The savory filling is topped with a golden, crispy crust that is both delicious and satisfying.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Creamy mashed sweet potatoes seasoned with a hint of cinnamon and nutmeg. The sweet, spicy flavor pairs perfectly with the savory main courses.
3.2) Green Beans Almondine: Tender green beans sautéed with garlic and almonds, finished with a touch of butter and lemon juice. The crunchy almonds add a delightful texture and a nutty, savory flavor.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert made with tart apples, a crispy oat topping, and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. The sweet, tart apples are perfectly balanced by the crispy, buttery oat topping and the creamy ice cream.
4.2) Chocolate Cake: A rich, decadent chocolate cake topped with a layer of chocolate ganache and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. The moist, chocolatey cake is a perfect indulgence for any sweet tooth.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Hot Chocolate: A rich, velvety hot chocolate made with real chocolate and milk. Served with a dollop of whipped cream and a marshmallow, it's the perfect drink to warm you up on a cold winter night.
5.2) Mulled Wine: A warm, spiced wine infused with fruits, orange peel, and cloves. The spicy, fruity flavors make it a delicious and festive drink to enjoy during the winter months.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
This week, we celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' with a special menu that features grilled salmon as the centerpiece.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Skewers: Fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil drizzled with balsamic glaze and olive oil. The fresh, juicy tomatoes, creamy mozzarella, and fragrant basil make for a delicious and refreshing appetizer.
1.2) Grilled Vegetable Skewers: Marinated vegetables grilled to perfection and served with a tangy dipping sauce. The smoky, charred flavor of the vegetables is perfectly balanced by the tangy dipping sauce.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Salmon: Fresh salmon fillets seasoned with herbs and spices, grilled to perfection and served with a lemon butter sauce. The tender, juicy salmon is perfectly cooked and the lemon butter sauce adds a delightful, tangy flavor.
2.2) Quinoa Salad: A refreshing, light salad made with quinoa, fresh vegetables, and a citrus vinaigrette. The quinoa is perfectly cooked and the fresh vegetables add a delightful crunch and a burst of flavor.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Grilled Asparagus: Tender asparagus spears grilled to perfection and seasoned with olive oil, salt, and pepper. The smoky, charred flavor of the asparagus is perfectly balanced by the subtle, earthy taste of the olive oil.
3.2) Grilled Corn on the Cob: Sweet, juicy corn on the cob grilled to perfection and served with a touch of butter and a sprinkle of chili powder. The smoky, charred flavor of the corn is perfectly balanced by the sweet, buttery taste.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Lemon Tart: A tangy, refreshing lemon tart with a buttery, flaky crust and a silky, creamy filling. The tart, tangy flavor of the lemon is perfectly balanced by the sweet, buttery crust.
4.2) Fresh Fruit Salad: A colorful, refreshing fruit salad made with a variety of seasonal fruits and a tangy citrus dressing. The sweet, juicy fruits are perfectly balanced by the tangy citrus dressing.
5. Drinks:
5.1) White Wine: A crisp, refreshing white wine that pairs perfectly with the light, refreshing flavors of the menu.
5.2) Iced Tea: A refreshing, cooling iced tea made with a blend of herbs and fruits. The perfect drink to quench your thirst on a hot summer night.
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
This week's menu features a selection of dishes that are both hearty and comforting, perfect for a cozy night in.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Meatballs: Tender, juicy meatballs made with a blend of ground meats and herbs, served with a tangy tomato sauce. The savory, meaty flavor of the meatballs is perfectly balanced by the tangy, savory tomato sauce.
1.2) Spinach and Feta Dip: A creamy, savory dip made with spinach, feta cheese, and a hint of garlic. Served with warm pita bread, it's a delicious and satisfying appetizer.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A hearty, flavorful stew made with tender beef, red wine, onions, carrots, and mushrooms. The rich, savory flavor of the beef is perfectly balanced by the tangy, savory wine and the tender, sweet vegetables.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A classic comfort food dish featuring tender chicken, vegetables, and a flaky, buttery crust. The savory filling is topped with a golden, crispy crust that is both delicious and satisfying.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Mashed Potatoes: Creamy, rich mashed potatoes seasoned with a hint of garlic and butter. The perfect accompaniment to the savory main courses.
3.2) Green Beans: Tender, crisp green beans sautéed with garlic and olive oil. The savory, garlicky flavor pairs perfectly with the hearty main courses.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert made with tart apples, a crispy oat topping, and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. The sweet, tart apples are perfectly balanced by the crispy, buttery oat topping and the creamy ice cream.
4.2) Chocolate Cake: A rich, decadent chocolate cake topped with a layer of chocolate ganache and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. The moist, chocolatey cake is a perfect indulgence for any sweet tooth.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A rich, full-bodied red wine that pairs perfectly with the hearty, savory flavors of the menu.
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A rich, velvety hot chocolate made with real chocolate and milk. Served with a dollop of whipped cream and a marshmallow, it's the perfect drink to warm you up on a cold winter night.
 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):
This week's menu features a selection of dishes that are both light and refreshing, perfect for a healthy start to the week.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Salad: A classic Italian salad made with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil, drizzled with balsamic glaze and olive oil. The fresh, juicy tomatoes, creamy mozzarella, and fragrant basil make for a delicious and refreshing appetizer.
1.2) Edamame: Tender, sweet soybeans served in the pod, sprinkled with sea salt. The perfect snack to start the meal or a delicious appetizer on its own.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Chicken Salad: A light, refreshing salad made with grilled chicken, mixed greens, avocado, cherry tomatoes, and a tangy vinaigrette. The grilled chicken adds a delicious, savory flavor to the salad, while the tangy vinaigrette adds a delightful zing.
2.2) Shrimp Scampi: Tender, succulent shrimp sautéed with garlic, butter, and white wine, served over a bed of pasta. The savory, garlicky flavor of the shrimp is perfectly balanced by the rich, buttery pasta.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Quinoa Salad: A refreshing, light salad made with quinoa, fresh vegetables, and a citrus vinaigrette. The quinoa is perfectly cooked and the fresh vegetables add a delightful crunch and a burst of flavor.
3.2) Grilled Asparagus: Tender asparagus spears grilled to perfection and seasoned with olive oil, salt, and pepper. The smoky, charred flavor of the asparagus is perfectly balanced by the subtle, earthy taste of the olive oil.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Fruit Sorbet: A refreshing, light sorbet made with a variety of seasonal fruits. The perfect dessert to cool down after a savory meal.
4.2) Lemon Tart: A tangy, refreshing lemon tart with a buttery, flaky crust and a silky, creamy filling. The tart, tangy flavor of the lemon is perfectly balanced by the sweet, buttery crust.
5. Drinks:
5.1) White Wine: A crisp, refreshing white wine that pairs perfectly with the light, refreshing flavors of the menu.
5.2) Iced Tea: A refreshing, cooling iced tea made with a blend of herbs and fruits. The perfect drink to quench your thirst on a hot summer day.

1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.2 Celebrate 'Saint Patrick's Day' on 03-17 with a special dish: Irish Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 02-02 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.4 Celebrate 'Veganuary Special' on 05-11 with a special dish: Vegan Mushroom Risotto.
1.5 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
2) Feature 'Seafood Season Extravaganza' from Week 32 to Week 35 with dishes like: Fresh Seafood Platter.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 21, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 03-28 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Valentine's Day Special' on 02-14 with a special dish: Heart-Shaped Red Velvet Cake.
1.3 Celebrate 'Easter Brunch' on 04-01 with a special dish: Spring Lamb Roast.
1.4 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-09 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.5 Celebrate 'Pancake Day Treat' on 02-13 with a special dish: Blueberry Pancakes.
2) Feature 'Winter Delicacies' from Week 17 to Week 18 with dishes like: Braised Game Meats.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 2, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
Soup and Salad Midweek.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Skewers: Cherry tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and basil leaves drizzled with balsamic glaze.
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy, warm dip made with spinach, artichoke hearts, and garlic, served with pita chips.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Chicken Alfredo: Tender chicken breast smothered in a creamy Alfredo sauce, served over pasta.
2.2) Vegetarian Lasagna: Layers of pasta, vegetables, and cheese baked to perfection.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Caesar Salad: Romaine lettuce topped with croutons, parmesan cheese, and Caesar dressing.
3.2) Minestrone Soup: A hearty vegetable soup filled with beans, pasta, and vegetables.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A warm, sweet dessert made with apples, oats, and brown sugar, topped with vanilla ice cream.
4.2) Cheesecake: A rich, velvety cheesecake with a graham cracker crust and a tangy lemon zest topping.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Assorted Beers: A selection of craft beers to pair with the hearty main courses.
5.2) Lemonade: A refreshing, tangy beverage to complement the lighter dishes.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Bruschetta: Toasted bread topped with tomatoes, garlic, basil, and mozzarella.
1.2) Crab Cakes: Delicate crab cakes made with jumbo lump crab meat, served with a tangy remoulade sauce.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A rich, hearty stew made with beef, red wine, onions, and mushrooms.
2.2) Vegetarian Paella: A colorful, flavorful rice dish made with saffron, vegetables, and beans.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Green Beans Almondine: Tender green beans sautéed with almonds and garlic.
3.2) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes mashed with butter, brown sugar, and a hint of cinnamon.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Brownies: Fudgy, decadent chocolate brownies topped with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
4.2) Crème Brûlée: A classic French dessert with a rich, creamy custard topped with a caramelized sugar crust.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A full-bodied red wine to complement the rich flavors of the main courses.
5.2) Sparkling Water: A refreshing, non-alcoholic beverage to cleanse the palate between courses.
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Deviled Eggs: Hard-boiled eggs filled with a savory, spiced yolk mixture.
1.2) Baked Brie: A wheel of brie cheese baked until melted and served with crackers and fruit.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Coq au Vin: Chicken cooked in red wine, bacon, mushrooms, and onions.
2.2) Vegetarian Shepherd's Pie: A hearty, savory pie made with vegetables, lentils, and a mashed potato topping.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted until tender and caramelized.
3.2) Cornbread: A sweet, savory cornbread served warm with honey butter.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Pecan Pie: A classic Southern dessert made with pecans, corn syrup, and a flaky pie crust.
4.2) Panna Cotta: A creamy, silky Italian dessert made with gelatin, cream, and sugar.
5. Drinks:
5.1) White Wine: A crisp, refreshing white wine to complement the lighter dishes.
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A rich, decadent hot chocolate topped with whipped cream and marshmallows.
 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Shrimp Ceviche: Fresh shrimp marinated in lime juice, mixed with onions, tomatoes, and cilantro.
1.2) Spinach and Feta Phyllo Triangles: Triangles of phyllo dough filled with spinach, feta cheese, and garlic, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Stroganoff: Tender beef strips cooked in a creamy mushroom sauce, served over egg noodles.
2.2) Vegetarian Stuffed Bell Peppers: Bell peppers stuffed with rice, beans, corn, and cheese, baked until tender.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Quinoa Salad: A light, refreshing salad made with quinoa, cucumber, tomatoes, and a lemon vinaigrette.
3.2) Roasted Asparagus: Asparagus roasted until tender and served with a tangy hollandaise sauce.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Lava Cake: A rich, decadent cake with a molten chocolate center, served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
4.2) Fruit Tart: A tart filled with a sweet, tangy fruit compote and topped with fresh fruit.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.
1.2 Celebrate 'Saint Patrick's Day' on 03-17 with a special dish: Irish Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'random of Year Party' on 11-06 with a special dish: Gourmet Cheese Platter.
1.4 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.5 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 08-31 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
2) Feature 'Squash and Pumpkin Delights' from Week 5 to Week 5 with dishes like: Pumpkin Pie.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 9, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_once.52: Christmas Gala Dinner featuring Roasted Goose
checks_once.11: Saint Patrick's Day featuring Irish Stew
checks_once.45: random of Year Party featuring Gourmet Cheese Platter

checks_once.35: Summer Solstice Celebration featuring Midsummer Night's Fish Fry

checks_range.5: Squash and Pumpkin Delights featuring Pumpkin Pie

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week's menu features dishes that are hearty and warming, perfect for the chilly winter weather.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) French Onion Soup: A classic soup made with caramelized onions, beef broth, and crusty bread.
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy dip made with spinach, artichokes, and melted cheese, served with pita chips.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A rich, slow-cooked stew made with beef, red wine, onions, and mushrooms.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A comforting dish made with chicken, vegetables, and a flaky pie crust.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted until tender and caramelized.
3.2) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes mashed with butter, brown sugar, and a hint of cinnamon.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert made with apples, oats, and brown sugar, topped with a crispy crumb topping.
4.2) Pecan Pie: A rich, nutty pie made with pecans, corn syrup, and a flaky pie crust.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A full-bodied red wine to pair with the hearty main courses.
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A warm, comforting drink made with rich chocolate and milk.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
This week's menu features dishes that are light and refreshing, perfect for those looking to detox after the holiday season.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Salad: A classic Italian salad made with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil, drizzled with balsamic glaze.
1.2) Edamame: Steamed soybeans seasoned with salt, perfect for a light and healthy snack.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Salmon: A healthy and flavorful dish made with fresh salmon, seasoned with lemon and herbs, and grilled to perfection.
2.2) Quinoa Salad: A hearty and nutritious salad made with quinoa, vegetables, and a tangy vinaigrette.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Grilled Asparagus: Tender asparagus spears grilled until slightly charred and seasoned with olive oil and salt.
3.2) Brown Rice: A simple and healthy side dish made with steamed brown rice.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Fruit Tart: A delicious dessert made with a tart shell and fresh fruit, topped with a sweet glaze.
4.2) Sorbet: A refreshing and light dessert made with fruit and sugar, served in scoops.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Green Tea: A healthy and refreshing drink made with hot water and green tea leaves.
5.2) Sparkling Water: A light and bubbly drink perfect for those looking to avoid alcohol.
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
This week's menu features dishes that are spicy and bold, perfect for those looking to add some excitement to their meals.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Spicy Tuna Roll: A classic sushi roll made with spicy tuna, avocado, and cucumber, wrapped in nori and served with soy sauce.
1.2) Jalapeno Poppers: Fried jalapeno peppers stuffed with cream cheese and bacon, served with a tangy dipping sauce.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Chicken Vindaloo: A spicy Indian dish made with chicken, potatoes, and a complex blend of spices.
2.2) Shrimp Curry: A flavorful and spicy dish made with shrimp, coconut milk, and a variety of aromatic spices.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Naan Bread: A soft and fluffy Indian flatbread perfect for soaking up the flavors of the curries.
3.2) Basmati Rice: A fragrant and aromatic rice dish that complements the bold flavors of the main courses.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chai Tea Pudding: A rich and creamy dessert made with chai tea, milk, and sugar, topped with a layer of whipped cream.
4.2) Mango Sticky Rice: A sweet and sticky dessert made with mango, rice, and coconut milk, served with a drizzle of sweetened condensed milk.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Mango Lassi: A refreshing and sweet drink made with mango, yogurt, and sugar.
5.2) Spicy Bloody Mary: A bold and spicy cocktail made with vodka, tomato juice, and a variety of spices.
 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):
This week's menu features dishes that showcase the delicious flavors of squash and pumpkin.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Pumpkin Soup: A creamy and comforting soup made with pumpkin, onions, and cream.
1.2) Roasted Squash Quesadilla: A delicious quesadilla filled with roasted squash, cheese, and cilantro.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Pumpkin Ravioli: A classic Italian dish made with pumpkin-filled ravioli, browned in butter, and served with a sage brown butter sauce.
2.2) Butternut Squash Lasagna: A hearty and flavorful lasagna made with layers of butternut squash, ricotta cheese, and marinara sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Maple Glazed Carrots: Tender carrots glazed with a sweet and sticky maple glaze.
3.2) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes mashed with butter, brown sugar, and a hint of cinnamon.

4.1) Pumpkin Pie: A classic dessert made with pumpkin, evaporated milk, and spices, baked in a pie crust.
4.2) Sweet Potato Casserole: A delicious casserole made with sweet potatoes, brown sugar, and marshmallows, topped with a crispy pecan crumb topping.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Apple Cider: A warm and comforting drink made with apple juice, cinnamon, and sugar.
5.2) Pumpkin Spice Latte: A delicious and seasonal coffee drink made with pumpkin spice and espresso.

This week's menu features dishes that are rich and indulgent, perfect for a special occasion or a romantic dinner.

5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the rich and indulgent flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate a special occasion or a romantic dinner.

5.2) Sparkling Water: A light and bubbly drink perfect for those looking to avoid alcohol.
 Menu Week 8 (February 19th - February 25th):
This week's menu features dishes that are comforting and warming, perfect for those looking to enjoy a cozy meal at home.

1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.

1.4 Celebrate 'Bastille Day Party' on 07-14 with a special dish: Coq au Vin.
1.5 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 03-21 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
2) Feature 'Seafood Season Extravaganza' from Week 5 to Week 5 with dishes like: Fresh Seafood Platter.

Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.

3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:

4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Cinco de Mayo Fiesta' on 05-05 with a special dish: Tacos Al Pastor.
1.2 Celebrate 'Labor Day BBQ' on 05-01 with a special dish: Grilled Steak.
1.3 Celebrate 'Bastille Day Party' on 07-14 with a special dish: Coq au Vin.
1.4 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-20 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.5 Celebrate 'Veganuary Special' on 11-30 with a special dish: Vegan Mushroom Risotto.
2) Feature 'Cherry Blossom Festival Dishes' from Week 2 to Week 5 with dishes like: Cherry Blossom Tea and Sweets.
3) Include 'Taco Tuesdays' every 3 weeks starting from Week 21, serving: Assorted Tacos.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
Cherry Blossom Festival Dishes
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Cherry Blossom Tea: A delicate blend of cherry blossom tea leaves, steeped to perfection and served hot.
1.2) Sushi Rolls with Cherry Blossom Petals: Fresh sushi rolls garnished with edible cherry blossom petals.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Cherry Blossom Salmon: Grilled salmon fillet glazed with a cherry blossom reduction sauce.
2.2) Cherry Blossom Chicken: Tender chicken breasts marinated in a cherry blossom and soy sauce mixture, grilled to perfection.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Cherry Blossom Rice: Fragrant jasmine rice infused with cherry blossom tea and garnished with cherry blossom petals.
3.2) Cherry Blossom Edamame: Steamed soybeans seasoned with cherry blossom salt.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Cherry Blossom Macarons: Delicate French macarons filled with a cherry blossom ganache.
4.2) Cherry Blossom Ice Cream: Creamy ice cream infused with the subtle flavor of cherry blossoms.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Sake: A selection of premium sake to complement the cherry blossom flavors.
5.2) Cherry Blossom Martini: A refreshing cocktail made with cherry blossom-infused vodka and a splash of cranberry juice.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Skewers: Fresh mozzarella, ripe tomatoes, and basil leaves drizzled with balsamic glaze.
1.2) Bruschetta: Toasted bread topped with a flavorful tomato and basil mixture.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Veal Parmesan: Tender veal cutlets breaded and fried, topped with marinara sauce and melted mozzarella cheese.
2.2) Spaghetti Bolognese: Hearty spaghetti pasta smothered in a rich and savory meat sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Bread: Warm, buttery garlic bread perfect for soaking up the flavors of the pasta sauce.
3.2) Caesar Salad: Crisp romaine lettuce topped with croutons, parmesan cheese, and a tangy caesar dressing.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
4.2) Chocolate Lava Cake: A decadent dessert with a molten chocolate center, served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A full-bodied red wine to complement the rich flavors of the veal and spaghetti.
5.2) Limoncello: A refreshing Italian lemon liqueur to cleanse the palate.

1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Veganuary Special' on 05-14 with a special dish: Vegan Mushroom Risotto.

This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
Celebrate 'Veganuary Special' on 05-14 with a special dish: Vegan Mushroom Risotto.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Skewers: Cherry tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and basil drizzled with balsamic glaze.
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy, warm dip made with spinach, artichokes, and garlic, served with pita chips.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Portobello Mushrooms: Marinated and grilled portobello mushrooms served with a side of quinoa and roasted vegetables.
2.2) Vegan Lentil Shepherd's Pie: A hearty, plant-based pie filled with lentils, vegetables, and topped with mashed potatoes.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted until caramelized and crispy, seasoned with garlic and lemon.
3.2) Sweet Potato Fries: Crispy sweet potato fries seasoned with smoked paprika and served with a tangy dipping sauce.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Vegan Chocolate Cake: A decadent, vegan chocolate cake made with almond milk and topped with a vegan chocolate ganache.
4.2) Fresh Fruit Salad: A colorful and refreshing fruit salad made with seasonal fruits and a citrus dressing.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Vegan Wines: A selection of vegan wines that do not contain animal products in their production.
5.2) Vegan Beers: A variety of vegan beers that do not contain animal products in their brewing process.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Smoked Salmon and Cream Cheese Bagels: Bagels topped with smoked salmon, cream cheese, red onion, and capers.
1.2) Bruschetta: Grilled bread topped with ripe tomatoes, fresh basil, garlic, and a drizzle of olive oil.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Pan-Seared Scallops: Seared scallops served with a lemon butter sauce and a side of asparagus.
2.2) Grilled Chicken with Mango Salsa: Grilled chicken breast served with a sweet and spicy mango salsa and a side of black beans.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Asparagus: Asparagus roasted until tender and seasoned with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
3.2) Garlic Roasted Potatoes: Potatoes roasted with garlic and herbs, creating a savory and aromatic side dish.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Crème Brûlée: A classic French dessert made with cream, sugar, and vanilla, topped with a caramelized sugar crust.
4.2) Apple Tart: A delicious apple tart with a flaky crust and a sweet, gooey apple filling.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine White Wines: A selection of fine white wines to complement the lighter flavors of the meals.
5.2) Sparkling Water: A refreshing alternative to alcoholic beverages, perfect for those who prefer a non-alcoholic option.
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Mini Crab Cakes: Delicate crab cakes made with jumbo lump crab meat, served with a tangy remoulade sauce.
1.2) Spinach and Feta Phyllo Triangles: Triangles of phyllo dough filled with spinach, feta cheese, and garlic, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Seared Tuna: Sear-cooked tuna served with a side of edamame and pickled ginger.
2.2) Vegetarian Paella: A flavorful Spanish rice dish made with saffron, bell peppers, peas, and artichokes.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Sautéed Spinach: Fresh spinach sautéed with garlic and olive oil, creating a simple yet delicious side dish.
3.2) Grilled Corn on the Cob: Grilled corn on the cob slathered with butter and seasoned with chili powder and paprika.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Cheesecake: A rich and creamy cheesecake topped with a tart raspberry sauce.
4.2) Chocolate Brownies: Fudgy chocolate brownies served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Red Wines: A selection of fine red wines to complement the rich flavors of the meals.
5.2) Sangria: A refreshing and fruity Spanish drink made with red wine, fruit, and brandy.
 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):
Celebrate 'Saint Patrick's Day' on 03-17 with a special dish: Irish Stew.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Corned Beef and Cabbage Rolls: Corned beef and cabbage wrapped in pastry dough, baked until golden.
1.2) Irish Soda Bread: A traditional Irish bread made with buttermilk and soda, served with a pat of butter.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Irish Stew: A hearty stew made with corned beef, potatoes, carrots, onions, and cabbage.
2.2) Vegetarian Shepherd's Pie: A vegetarian version of the classic shepherd's pie, made with lentils, vegetables, and topped with mashed potatoes.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Colcannon: A traditional Irish dish made with mashed potatoes and kale or cabbage.
3.2) Corned Beef Hash: A savory hash made with corned beef, potatoes, onions, and bell peppers.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Irish Apple Cake: A moist and flavorful apple cake topped with a caramel sauce.
4.2) Baileys Irish Cream Cheesecake: A decadent cheesecake infused with Baileys Irish Cream.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Irish Whiskey: A selection of fine Irish whiskeys to enjoy responsibly.
5.2) Guinness: The iconic Irish stout beer, perfect for sipping alongside the hearty stew.
 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Shrimp Ceviche: Fresh shrimp marinated in lime juice, mixed with red onion, cilantro, and jalapeño.
1.2) Quesadilla: A warm and cheesy quesadilla filled with chicken, bell peppers, onions, and avocado.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Independence Day Celebration' on 07-04 with a special dish: American Apple Pie.
1.2 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.3 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 02-07 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.4 Celebrate 'Oktoberfest Beer Dinner' on 10-06 with a special dish: Sausages and Sauerkraut.
1.5 Celebrate 'Valentine's Day Special' on 02-14 with a special dish: Heart-Shaped Red Velvet Cake.
2) Feature 'Cherry Blossom Festival Dishes' from Week 7 to Week 9 with dishes like: Cherry Blossom Tea and Sweets.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 2, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):

1. Appetizers:

1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy, warm dip made with spinach, artichoke hearts, and garlic, served with pita chips.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Chicken Alfredo: Tender chicken breast smothered in a creamy Alfredo sauce, served over pasta.
2.2) Vegetarian Lasagna: Layers of pasta, vegetables, and cheese baked to perfection.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Caesar Salad: Romaine lettuce topped with croutons, parmesan cheese, and Caesar dressing.
3.2) Minestrone Soup: A hearty vegetable soup filled with beans, pasta, and vegetables.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A warm, sweet apple dessert topped with a crispy oatmeal topping.

5. Drinks:

5.2) Sparkling Water: A refreshing, non-alcoholic option for those who prefer not to drink alcohol.
